KPK Kawal Optimalisasi Penerimaan Pajak di Sumatera Selatan
05 Nov 2019, 13:43 by Rian Apridhani


KPK Kawal Optimalisasi Penerimaan Pajak di Sumatera Selatan

KBRN, Palembang : Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) menyatakan akan mengawasi optimalisasi penerimaan pajak di Sumatera Selatan yang ditandai dengan dimulainya Perjanjian Kerjasama (PKS) antara Pemerintah Provinsi Sumatera Selatan dan Kantor Wilayah Direktorat Jendral Pajak Sumatera Selatan dan Bangka Belitung.
Koordinator Wilayah II Sumatera Satgas Korsupgah Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi, Abdul Haris, mengungkapkan, KPK mendorong optimalisasi penerimaan pajak daerah agar Pemerintah Daerah lebih mandiri dalam pembiayaan APBD.
Haris mengatakan, hasil dari kerjasama antara Pemda dan Kanwil DJP selalu dilaporkan kepada KPK setiap harinya. Dengan akses data yang dimiliki, KPK akan terus memonitor kerjasama antara setiap OPD dan Kanwil DJP dan KPK memastikan akan menegur Gubernur bila ada OPD yang tidak menindaklanjuti.
“Jangan sampai PKS (Perjanjian Kerjasama) sudah ditandatangani mereka ini diam-diam tidur, kami tidak mau. Disitulah fungsi KPK, kami bisa mengeur OPD melalui Gubernur,” ujar Haris saat diwawancarai wartawan usai Penandatangan Kerjasama antara Kawil DJP Sumsel Babel dengan OPD Pemprov Sumsel tentang Koordinasi Optimalisasi Penerimaan Pajak Pusat, Pajak Daerah dan Rettribusi Daerah di Sumsel, di Palembang, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Sementara Kepala Kanwil SJP Sumsel Babel, Imam Arifin, mengatakan, melalui kerjasama antara OPD Pemprov Sumsel dengan Kanwil DJP Sumsel Babel maka setiap kegiatan Wajib Pajak (WP) yang bersinggungan dengan aktifitas OPD seperti pengurusan izin dsb akan terdata.
“Nanti akan ditanya bagaimana NPWP nya, SPT nya apakah rajin atau tidak. Bila sudah lengkap maka baru akan diproses. Intinya untuk sinergi data, agar pengawasan terkait dengan kwajiban pajak ke Pemerintah Pusat bisa terpenuhi,” pungkas Imam.

KPK Guarded the Optimization of Tax Revenue in South Sumatra
05 Nov 2019, 13:43 by Rian Apridhani


KPK Guarded the Optimization of Tax Revenue in South Sumatra

KBRN, Palembang: The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) said it would oversee the optimization of tax revenue in South Sumatra, which was marked by the commencement of the Cooperation Agreement (PKS) between the Government of South Sumatra Province and the Regional Office of the Directorate General of Taxation of South Sumatra and Bangka Belitung.
The Region II Coordinator of the Sumatra Korsupgah Task Force for the Corruption Eradication Commission, Abdul Haris, revealed that the KPK encouraged the optimization of local tax revenue so that the Regional Government was more independent in financing the APBD.
Haris said, the results of collaboration between the Regional Government and the Regional Office of the DGT are always reported to the KPK every day. With access to data held, the KPK will continue to monitor the collaboration between each OPD and the Regional Office of the DGT and the KPK to ensure that it will reprimand the Governor if there is an OPD that does not follow up.
"Don't let the PKS (Cooperation Agreement) already signed by them secretly sleep, we don't want to. That is where the KPK functions, we can arrange OPD through the Governor, "said Haris when interviewed by reporters after the Cooperation Signing between the North Sumatra Regional Tax Office (BKS) of North Sumatra and the South Sumatra Provincial OPD about Coordination of the Optimization of Central Tax Revenue, Regional Tax and Regional Retribution in Palembang, Tuesday (5) / 11/2019).
While the Head of the Regional Office of the South Sumatra SJP Regional Office, Imam Arifin, said, through cooperation between the South Sumatra Provincial OPD Regional Office and the Regional Office of the South Sumatra DJP Regional Office, each Taxpayer (WP) activity that intersects with OPD activities such as obtaining permits etc. will be recorded.
"Later, we will be asked how the NPWP, whether the SPT is diligent or not. When it is complete then it will be processed. The point is for data synergy, so that supervision related to tax obligations to the Central Government can be fulfilled, "concluded Imam.
